contentrichtext.text: The '''X-group''' of [[asteroid]]s collects together several types with similar spectra, but probably quite different compositions. ==Tholen classification== In the [[asteroid spectral types#Tholen classification|Tholen classification]] the '''X-group''' contains the types: * [[E-type asteroid|E-type]] * [[M-type asteroid|M-type]], the largest grouping * [[P-type asteroid|P-type]] Since in this scheme the [[albedo]] is crucial in discriminating between the above types, some objects for which [[albedo]] information was not available were assigned an '''X-type'''. An example of this is [[50 Virginia]]. ==SMASS classification== The [[asteroid spectral types#SMASS classification|SMASS classification]] does not use [[albedo]], but several spectral types are distinguished on the basis of [[electromagnetic spectrum|spectral]] features which were too subtle to be visible in the broad-band ECAS survey used for the [[asteroid spectral types#Tholen classification|Tholen scheme]]. The '''X-group''' contains the types: *core '''X-type''' containing the asteroids with the most "typical" spectra *Xe-type of asteroids whose spectra contain a moderately broad absorption band around 0.49 μm. It has been suggested that this indicates the presence of [[troilite]] (FeS). There is some correlation between this group and the Tholen [[E-type asteroid|E-type]]. *Xc- and Xk-type asteroids, which contain a broad convex [[electromagnetic spectrum|spectral]] feature in the range 0.55 μm to 0.8 μm (i.e. increased [[flux#electromagnetic_radiation|flux]] in this range). These [[electromagnetic spectrum|spectra]] tend to be intermediate between the core '''X-type''' and the [[C-type asteroid|C]] and [[K-type asteroid|K-type]]. Apart from the Xe-type, there is no significant correlation between the split into these SMASS types and the Tholen [[E-type asteroid|E]], [[M-type asteroid|M]], and [[P-type asteroid|P-type]]s. All the types in the '''X-group''' contain a mixture of asteroids classified as either type [[E-type asteroid|E]], [[M-type asteroid|M]], or [[P-type asteroid|P]]. ==See also== *[[Asteroid spectral types]] *[[L-type asteroid]] *[[S-type asteroid]] *[[K-type asteroid]] ==References== #<div id="Bus2002">S.
